title: Authentication and Billing reference guide for Seven Bridges API R Client
text: use direct authentication, users need specify one platform url, corresponding token. Examples direct authentication: use Seven Bridges Platform AWS (US). use specified url base URL API calls. example, url points BioData Catalyst powered Seven Bridges. use Seven Bridges Platform AWS since neither platform url explicitly specified. Note: platform url specified time.
code: # Direct authentication with setting platform parameter a <- Auth$new(   token = "<your_token>",   platform = "aws-us" ) # Direct authentication with setting url parameter a <- Auth$new(   token = "<your_token>",   url = "https://api.sb.biodatacatalyst.nhlbi.nih.gov/v2/" ) # Direct authentication on default aws-us platform a <- Auth$new(token = "<your_token>")

title: Authentication and Billing reference guide for Seven Bridges API R Client
text: R API client supports reading authentication information stored system environment variables. set two environment variables system, use function sbg_set_env(). example: See environment variables correctly set: Now can create Auth object: unset two environment variables: need logged multiple accounts time essential provide environment variables accounts. course, variables must different names. pre-set environment variables, can create following way: Now ready create authentication object two accounts:
code: # Set environment variables sevenbridges2:::sbg_set_env(   url = "https://cgc-api.sbgenomics.com/v2",   token = "<your_token>" ) # Check environment variables sevenbridges2:::sbg_get_env("SB_API_ENDPOINT") ## "https://cgc-api.sbgenomics.com/v2"  sevenbridges2:::sbg_get_env("SB_AUTH_TOKEN") ## "<your_token>" # Authenticate using environment variables a <- Auth$new(from = "env") # Unset environment variables Sys.unsetenv("SB_API_ENDPOINT") Sys.unsetenv("SB_AUTH_TOKEN") # Set environment variables for the first account sevenbridges2:::sbg_set_env(   url = "https://api.sbgenomics.com/v2",   token = "<your_token>",   sysenv_url_name = "account_1_url",   sysenv_token_name = "account_1_token" )  # Set environment variables for the second account sevenbridges2:::sbg_set_env(   url = "https://api.sb.biodatacatalyst.nhlbi.nih.gov/v2/",   token = "<your_token>",   sysenv_url_name = "account_2_url",   sysenv_token_name = "account_2_token" ) # Authenticate using the first account a <- sevenbridges2::Auth$new(   from = "env",   sysenv_url = "account_1_url",   sysenv_token = "account_1_token" )  # Authenticate using the second account b <- sevenbridges2::Auth$new(   from = "env",   sysenv_url = "account_2_url",   sysenv_token = "account_2_token" )

title: Authentication and Billing reference guide for Seven Bridges API R Client
text: Similar offset limit, every API call accepts argument named advance_access. argument first introduced August 2017 controls special field HTTP request header sent, can enable access “Advance Access” features Seven Bridges API. addition modifying API call uses Advance Access features, option can also set globally beginning API script. offers one-button switch users want experiment Advance Access features. option disabled default: example, try use Markers API list markers available BAM file advance_access option disabled, return error message: enable Advance Access features, one can use beginning scripts. Let’s check option enabled: Send API call : information markers available BAM file returned:
code: # Load package and check advance access option library("sevenbridges2") getOption("sevenbridges2")$advance_access ## [1] FALSE # Authenticate first a <- Auth$new(token = "<your_token>", platform = "aws-us")  # Try to send request to list markers req <- a$api(   path = "genome/markers?file={bam_file_id}",   method = "GET" ) ## !HTTP Status 400: Advance access feature needs X-SBG-Advance-Access: advance header. # Enable advance access option opt <- getOption("sevenbridges2") opt$advance_access <- TRUE options(sevenbridges2 = opt) # Check advance_access option again getOption("sevenbridges2")$advance_access ## [1] TRUE # Send request again to list markers req <- a$api(   path = "genome/markers?file={bam_file_id}",   method = "GET" ) # Read content httr::content(req) $href [1] "https://api.sbgenomics.com/v2/genome/markers?file={bam_file_id}&offset=0&limit=50"  $items $items[[1]] $items[[1]]$href [1] "https://api.sbgenomics.com/v2/genome/markers/{bam_file_id}"  $items[[1]]$id [1] "{bam_file_id}"  $items[[1]]$name [1] "Marker Title"  $items[[2]] $items[[2]]$href [1] "https://api.sbgenomics.com/v2/genome/markers/{bam_file_id}"  $items[[2]]$id [1] "{bam_file_id}"  $items[[2]]$name [1] "Marker Title"  $links list()

Negations nesting can combined freely, , example, can issue p$list_files(fields = c("id", "name", "size", "!metadata.library", "!origin")).

title: File upload and Volumes reference guide for Seven Bridges API R Client
text: can upload files local computer Platform using upload() method Auth object. method allows upload single file now. upload file, provide full path local computer path parameter. specify upload destination file can use either project parent parameter. two parameters used together. project - Project object project ID. parent - File object (type Folder) ID. calling upload() method creating upload job default starts run immediately. don’t want start job immediately, just set init parameter TRUE order initialize object. upload job wrapped object class Upload can see details call actions . Let’s initialize upload job upload file project: like upload file folder, need set parent parameter:
code: # Authenticate a <- Auth$new(platform = "aws-us", token = "<your-token>")  # Get the desired project to upload to destination_project <- a$projects$get(project = "<project_id>")  # Create upload job and set destination project upload_job <- a$upload(   path = "/path/to/your/file.txt",   project = destination_project,   overwrite = TRUE,   init = TRUE ) # Get destination folder object destination_folder <- a$files$get(id = "<folder_id>")  up <- a$upload(   path = "/path/to/your/file.txt",   parent = destination_folder,   overwrite = TRUE,   init = TRUE )

Similarly, can write files Seven Bridges environment cloud storage ‘exporting’ volume. Learn volumes Seven Bridges Platform, CGC, BDC CAVATICA. volume related operations querying volumes, fetching single volume, creating volumes grouped volumes path (Volumes resource class) authentication object. operating single volume, represented object Volume class stores volume information returned API additional methods able call directly volume, like volume update, deactivation, listing content, volume members management etc. Note operations volumes require advance_access parameter set TRUE. volume operations pre-set TRUE default.

what: Create volumes - AWS (S3) using IAM User authentication type
title: File upload and Volumes reference guide for Seven Bridges API R Client
text: creating volumes exposed several functions different cloud providers authentication types: create_s3_using_iam_user: creates S3 volume using IAM User authentication type create_s3_using_iam_role: creates S3 volume using IAM Role authentication type create_google_using_iam_user: creates GC volume using IAM User authentication type create_google_using_iam_role: creates GC volume using IAM Role authentication type create_azure: creates Azure volume (RO privileges allowed) create_ali_oss: creates AliCloud volume (RO privileges allowed) functions possible provide parameters via path (from_path) JSON file required fields listed. Examples use shown :
code: # Create AWS volume using IAM User authentication type aws_iam_user_volume <- a$volumes$create_s3_using_iam_user(   name = "my_new_aws_user_volume",   bucket = "<bucket-name>",   description = "AWS IAM User volume",   access_key_id = "<access-key>",   secret_access_key = "<secret-access-key>" )  aws_iam_user_volume_from_path <- a$volumes$create_s3_using_iam_user(   from_path = "path/to/my/json/file.json" )   # Create AWS volume using IAM Role authentication type aws_iam_role_volume <- a$volumes$create_s3_using_iam_role(   name = "my_new_aws_role_volume",   bucket = "<bucket-name>",   description = "AWS IAM Role volume",   role_arn = "<role-arn-key>",   external_id = "<external-id>" )  aws_iam_role_volume_from_path <- a$volumes$create_s3_using_iam_role(   from_path = "path/to/my/json/file.json" )  # Create Google Cloud volume using IAM User authentication type gc_iam_user_volume <- a$volumes$create_google_using_iam_user(   name = "my_new_gc_user_volume",   access_mode = "RW",   bucket = "<bucket-name>",   description = "GC IAM User volume",   client_email = "<client_email>",   private_key = "<private_key-string>" )  gc_iam_user_volume_from_path <- a$volumes$create_google_using_iam_user(   from_path = "path/to/my/json/file.json" )  # Create Google Cloud volume using IAM Role authentication type # by passing configuration parameter as named list gc_iam_role_volume <- a$volumes$create_google_using_iam_role(   name = "my_new_gc_role_volume",   access_mode = "RO",   bucket = "<bucket-name>",   description = "GC IAM Role volume",   configuration = list(     type = "<type-name>",     audience = "<audience-link>",     subject_token_type = "<subject_token_type>",     service_account_impersonation_url = "<service_account_impersonation_url>",     token_url = "<token_url>",     credential_source = list(       environment_id = "<environment_id>",       region_url = "<region_url>",       url = "<url>",       regional_cred_verification_url = "<regional_cred_verification_url>"     )   ) )  # Create Google Cloud volume using IAM Role authentication type # by passing configuration parameter as string path to configuration file gc_iam_role_volume_config_file <- a$volumes$create_google_using_iam_role(   name = "my_new_gc_role_volume_cnf_file",   access_mode = "RO",   bucket = "<bucket-name>",   description = "GC IAM Role volume - using config file",   configuration = "path/to/config/file.json" )  # Create Google Cloud volume using IAM Role authentication type # using from_path parameter gc_iam_role_volume_from_path <- a$volumes$create_google_using_iam_role(   from_path = "path/to/full/config/file.json" )  # Create Azure volume azure_volume <- a$volumes$create_azure(   name = "my_new_azure_volume",   description = "Azure volume",   endpoint = "<endpoint>",   container = "<bucket-name",   storage_account = "<storage_account-name>",   tenant_id = "<tenant_id>",   client_id = "<client_id>",   client_secret = "<client_secret>",   resource_id = "<resource_id>" )  azure_volume_from_path <- a$volumes$create_azure(   from_path = "path/to/my/json/file.json" )  # Create Ali Cloud volume ali_volume <- a$volumes$create_ali_oss(   name = "my_new_azure_volume",   description = "Ali volume",   endpoint = "<endpoint>",   bucket = "<bucket-name",   access_key_id = "<access_key_id>",   secret_access_key = "<secret_access_key>" )  ali_volume_from_path <- a$volumes$create_ali_oss(   from_path = "path/to/my/json/file.json" )

title: File upload and Volumes reference guide for Seven Bridges API R Client
text: operation lists volume files root directory bucket, unless parent parameter specified. case, lists content directory bucket. output VolumeContentCollection collection object, contains two fields: -items storing list VolumeFile objects (files volume) -prefixes storing list VolumePrefix objects folders volume. can also specify limit parameter control number results returned. Collection objects, also pagination functions return either next page results results. However, backward pagination available volume contents. Users can also navigate pages results using continuation token parameter link fetch next chunk results. use link parameter, overwrite parameters set, since already contains limit continuation_token info.
code: # List all files in root bucket directory content_collection <- aws_iam_user_volume$list_contents(limit = 20)  # Print collection content_collection  # List all files from a specific directory on the bucket folder_files_collection <- aws_iam_user_volume$list_contents(   prefix = "<directory_name>" )  # Get the next group of results by setting the continuation token content_collection <- aws_iam_user_volume$list_contents(   limit = 20,   continuation_token = "<continuation_token>" )  # Preview volume files content_collection$items  # Preview volume prefixes/folders content_collection$prefixes  # Preview links aws_iam_user_volume$links  # Get the next group of results by setting the link parameter aws_iam_user_volume$list_contents(link = "<link_to_next_results>")  # Or use VolumeContentCollection object's next_page() method for this: content_collection$next_page()  # You can also fetch all results with the all() method content_collection$all()

Choose one methods : Direct authentication. provide developer token base URL platform interest (alternatively, can provide name platform - available options cgc, aws-us, aws-eu, ali-cn, cavatica, f4c - default platform aws-us) function call arguments Auth$new(). create platform authentication object temporarily set token platform base URL environment variables SB_AUTH_TOKEN SB_API_ENDPOINT. way, token directly stored Auth object, still able access calling get_token() method. Keep mind environment variables session-specific deleted session ends. Authentication via system environment variables. default read credential information two existing system environment variables: SB_API_ENDPOINT SB_AUTH_TOKEN. course, assuming previously set environment variables. Alternatively, can specify names system environment variables want loaded using sysenv_token sysenv_url arguments. Authentication via user configuration file. file, default $HOME/.sevenbridges/credentials, provides organized way collect manage API authentication information Seven Bridges platforms. need logged multiple accounts time (can also different platforms), please use either second third method. Method 1: Direct authentication common method construct Auth object. example: Method 2: Environment variables set two environment variables system, use function sbg_set_env(). example: Note environment variables session-specific. Create Auth object: Method 3: User configuration file Assume already created configuration file named credentials directory $HOME/.sevenbridges/: load user profile aws-us-<username> configuration file, simply use: profile_name specified, try load profile named [default]: option based use configuration file also enables simultaneous authentication multiple accounts. Assuming configuration file like one listed , want create authentication objects two profiles (default aws-us-<username>), can achieve following way: Note: API paths (base URLs) differ Seven Bridges environment. sure provide correct path environment using. code: # Load package library("sevenbridges2") # Authenticate with direct method a <- Auth$new(platform = "aws-us", token = "<your-token>") # Set environment variables sevenbridges2:::sbg_set_env(   url = "https://api.sbgenomics.com/v2/",   token = "<your_token>" ) # Authenticate using environment variables a <- Auth$new(from = "env") [aws-us-<username>] api_endpoint = https://api.sbgenomics.com/v2 auth_token = token_for_this_user  # another user on the same platform [aws-us-rosalind-franklin] api_endpoint = https://api.sbgenomics.com/v2 auth_token = token_for_this_user  [cgc] api_endpoint = https://cgc-api.sbgenomics.com/v2 auth_token = token_for_this_user  [bdc] api_endpoint = https://api.sb.biodatacatalyst.nhlbi.nih.gov/v2/ auth_token = token_for_this_user # Load aws-us-<username> profile for authentication a <- Auth$new(   from = "file",   profile_name = "aws-us-<username>" ) # Load default profile a <- Auth$new(from = "file") # Create Auth object with 'default' account a <- Auth$new(from = "file", profile_name = "default")  # Create Auth object with 'aws-us-<username>' account b <- Auth$new(from = "file", profile_name = "aws-us-<username>")

code: # Search by name matching, with limit 10 public_apps <- a$apps$query(   visibility = "public",   limit = 10,   query_terms = list("STAR") )  # Search by ID star_app <- a$apps$get(   id = "admin/sbg-public-data/rna-seq-alignment-star/0" ) # Copy app into the project a$apps$copy(   app = star_app,   project = "<username_or_division>/api-testing",   name = "New copy of STAR" )  # Check if it is copied p <- a$projects$get(id = "<username_or_division>/api-testing")  # List the apps you have in your project p$list_apps() == App == id : <username_or_division>/api-testing/newcopyofstar/0 name : RNA-seq Alignment - STAR project : <username_or_division>/api-testing revision : 0 # Get public app RNA Sequencing alignment - STAR star_app <- a$apps$get(   id = "admin/sbg-public-data/rna-seq-alignment-star/0" )  # Copy it into a project star_app$copy(   project = "<username_or_division>/api-testing",   name = "Copy of STAR" )

title: Introduction and Quickstart for Seven Bridges API R Client
text: Running tasks spot instances potentially reduce considerable amount computational cost. option can controlled project level task level Seven Bridges platforms. package follows logic platform’s web interface (current default setting spot instances ). example, create project using Projects resource’s method create(), can set use_interruptible = FALSE use -demand instances (non-interruptible expensive) instead spot instances (interruptible cheaper): new tasks created project use -demand instances run default, unless argument use_interruptible_instances specifically set TRUE drafting new task using Tasks resource method create(). example, p spot disabled project, draft task use spot instances run: Conversely, can spot instance enabled project, draft run specific tasks using -demand instances, setting use_interruptible_instances = FALSE create_task() explicitly. Please check vignette("Projects_and_Tasks_execution", package = "sevenbridges2") technical details running tasks using spot instances.
code: # Create project with disabled spot instances p <- a$projects$create(   name = "spot-disabled-project", bid, description = "spot disabled project",   use_interruptible = FALSE ) # Create task and set usage of interruptible instances to TRUE tsk <- p$create_task(   name = paste0("spot enabled task in a spot disabled project"),   description = "spot enabled task",   app = copied_star_app,   inputs = list(     "fastq" = c(input_files[[1]], input_files[[2]]),     "genomeFastaFiles" = input_files[[3]],     "sjdbGTFfile" = list(input_files[[4]])   ),   use_interruptible_instances = TRUE )

title: Introduction and Quickstart for Seven Bridges API R Client
text: workflow development benchmarking, sometimes need view make adjustments computational resources needed task run efficiently. Also, task fails due resource deficiency, often want define larger instance task re-run without editing app . particularly important cases enough disk space. Seven Bridges API allows setting specific task execution parameters using execution_settings. includes instance type (instance_type) maximum number parallel instances (max_parallel_instances): details execution_settings, please check create new draft task. Please check vignette("Projects_and_Tasks_execution", package = "sevenbridges2") technical details execution hints.
code: # Create task with setting instance type and number of parallel instances tsk <- p$create_task(   ...,   execution_settings = list(     instance_type = "c4.2xlarge;ebs-gp2;2000",     max_parallel_instances = 2   ) )

title: Introduction and Quickstart for Seven Bridges API R Client
text: Now let’s batch 4 files 2 groups, batched metadata sample_id. assume file metadata field entered. Since files can evenly grouped 2, single parent batch task 2 child tasks. Now draft batch task. Please check visual interface. response body inform errors warnings. can also check parent task’s children status list_batch_children() method child execution details: Please check vignette("Projects_and_Tasks_execution", package = "sevenbridges2") technical details running batch tasks.
code: # Add two more fastq files that will be used in our task inputs # and copy them into our API testing project reads_3 <- a$files$get(id = "641c48c425ed1842bd0bf7b6") # file id reads_3$copy_to(project = p)  reads_4 <- a$files$get(id = "641c48c425ed1842bd0bf7a5") # file id reads_4$copy_to(project = p)  # Get all project files input_files <- p$list_files()$items  taskName <- paste0("STAR-alignment ", date())  # Create task with batch criteria tsk <- p$create_task(   name = taskName,   description = "Batch Star Test",   app = copied_star_app,   batch = TRUE,   batch_input = "fastq",   batch_by = list(     type = "CRITERIA",     criteria = list("metadata.sample_id")   ),   inputs = list(     "fastq" = c(       input_files[[1]],       input_files[[2]],       input_files[[3]],       input_files[[4]]     ),     "genomeFastaFiles" = input_files[[5]],     "sjdbGTFfile" = list(input_files[[6]])   ) )  # Run batch task tsk$run() # List parent task children and their execution details child_tasks <- tsk$list_batch_children()  child1_details <- child_tasks$items[[1]]$get_execution_details() child2_details <- child_tasks$items[[2]]$get_execution_details()

title: R6 Class representing an app — App
text: project ID string project Project object want create task . revision app revision (version) number. name name task. description optional description task. execution_settings Named list detailed task execution parameters. Detailed task execution parameters: instance_type: Possible value specific instance type, e.g. "instance_type" = "c4.2xlarge;ebs-gp2;2000"; max_parallel_instances: Maximum number instances running time. Takes integer value equal greater 1, e.g. "max_parallel_instances" = 2.; use_memoization: Set FALSE default. Set TRUE enable memoization; use_elastic_disk: Set TRUE enable Elastic Disk. example:   inputs List objects. See section specifying task inputs information creating task input objects. example various input types:   output_location output location list allows define exact location task outputs stored. location can either defined entire project using main_location parameter, individually per output node, setting nodes_override parameter true defining individual output node locations within nodes_location. See details. main_location - Defines output location output nodes task. Can string path within project task created, example /Analysis/<task_id>_<task_name>/ path attached volume, volumes://volume_name/<project_id>/html. Parts path enclosed angle brackets <> tokens dynamically replaced corresponding values task execution. main_location_alias: string location (path) project point actual location outputs stored. Used main_location defined volume path (starting volumes://), provide easy way accessing output data directly project files. nodes_override: Enables defining output locations output nodes individually nodes_location (see ). Set TRUE able define individual locations per output node. Default: FALSE. Even nodes_override set TRUE, necessary define output locations output nodes individually. Data output nodes locations explicitly defined nodes_location either placed main_location (defined) project files root main output location defined task. nodes_location: List output paths individual task output nodes following format output node:  = list( "output_location" = "", "output_location_alias" = "" ) {r} b64html = list( "output_location" = "volumes://outputs/tasks/mar-19", "output_location_alias" = "/rfranklin/tasks/picard" )  example , b64html ID output node want define output location, parameters defined follows: output_location - Can path within project task created, example /Analysis/<task_id>_<task_name>/ path attached volume, volumes://volume_name/<project_id>/html. Also accepts tokens. output_location_alias - location (path) project point exact location output stored. Used output_location defined volume path (starting volumes://). batch set FALSE default. Set TRUE create batch task specify batch_input batch-criteria described . batch_input ID input wish batch. typically batch input consisting list files. parameter omitted, default batching criteria defined app used. batch_by Batching criteria form list. example:   use_interruptible_instances field can TRUE FALSE. Set field TRUE allow use spot instances. action set run, task run immediately upon creation. ... arguments can passed core api() function like 'fields', etc.
code: execution_settings <- list(   "instance_type" = "c4.2xlarge;ebs-gp2;2000",   "max_parallel_instances" = 2,   "use_memoization" = TRUE,   "use_elastic_disk" = TRUE   ) inputs <- list(   "input_file"= "<file_id/file_object>",   "input_directory" = "<folder_id/folder_object>",   "input_array_string" = list("<string_elem_1>", "<string_elem_2>"),   "input_boolean" = TRUE,   "input_double" = 54.6,   "input_enum" = "enum_1",   "input_float" = 11.2,   "input_integer" = "asdf",   "input_long" = 4212,   "input_string" = "test_string",   "input_record" = list(     "input_record_field_file" = "<file_id/file_object>",     "input_record_field_integer" = 42    )   ) batch_by = list(   type = "CRITERIA",   criteria = list("metadata.condition") )

text: Authentication method. : "direct" - pass credential information arguments directly, "env" - read pre-set system environment variables, "file" - read configurations credentials file. Default "direct". platform platform use. platform url specified, default "aws-us" (Seven Bridges Platform - US). possible values include: "aws-eu" - Seven Bridges Platform - EU, "cgc" - Cancer Genomics Cloud, "ali-cn" - Seven Bridges Platform - China, "cavatica" - Cavatica, "f4c" - BioData Catalyst Powered Seven Bridges. url Base URL API. Please use want specify platform platform list , also leaving platform unspecified. token authentication token. Authentication token uniquely identifies ⁨Seven Bridges⁩ Platform data access, app management task execution permissions. Read usage . sysenv_url Name system environment variable storing API base URL. default: "SB_API_ENDPOINT". sysenv_token Name system environment variable storing auth token. default: "SB_AUTH_TOKEN". config_file Location user configuration file. default: "~/.sevenbridges/credentials". profile_name Profile name user configuration file. default value "default". fs FS (FileSystem) object, mount unmount file system. authorization token API authentication token (FALSE) access token Seven Bridges single sign-(TRUE)?

title: R6 Class representing a project. — Project
text: app ID app App object want run. Recall apps specified projects, form {project_id}/{app_name}. revision app revision (version) number. name name task. description optional description task. execution_settings Named list detailed task execution parameters. Detailed task execution parameters: instance_type: Possible value specific instance type, e.g. "instance_type" = "c4.2xlarge;ebs-gp2;2000"; max_parallel_instances: Maximum number instances running time. Takes integer value equal greater 1, e.g. "max_parallel_instances" = 2.; use_memoization: Set FALSE default. Set TRUE enable memoization; use_elastic_disk: Set TRUE enable Elastic Disk. example:   inputs List objects. See section specifying task inputs information creating task input objects. example various input types:   output_location output location list allows define exact location task outputs stored. location can either defined entire project using main_location parameter, individually per output node, setting nodes_override parameter true defining individual output node locations within nodes_location. See details. main_location - Defines output location output nodes task. Can string path within project task created, example /Analysis/<task_id>_<task_name>/ path attached volume, volumes://volume_name/<project_id>/html. Parts path enclosed angle brackets <> tokens dynamically replaced corresponding values task execution. main_location_alias: string location (path) project point actual location outputs stored. Used main_location defined volume path (starting volumes://), provide easy way accessing output data directly project files. nodes_override: Enables defining output locations output nodes individually nodes_location (see ). Set TRUE able define individual locations per output node. Default: FALSE. Even nodes_override set TRUE, necessary define output locations output nodes individually. Data output nodes locations explicitly defined nodes_location either placed main_location (defined) project files root main output location defined task. nodes_location: List output paths individual task output nodes following format output node:  = list( "output_location" = "", "output_location_alias" = "" ) {r} b64html = list( "output_location" = "volumes://outputs/tasks/mar-19", "output_location_alias" = "/rfranklin/tasks/picard" )  example , b64html ID output node want define output location, parameters defined follows: output_location - Can path within project task created, example /Analysis/<task_id>_<task_name>/ path attached volume, volumes://volume_name/<project_id>/html. Also accepts tokens. output_location_alias - location (path) project point exact location output stored. Used output_location defined volume path (starting volumes://). batch set FALSE default. Set TRUE create batch task specify batch_input batch-criteria described . batch_input ID input wish batch. typically batch input consisting list files. parameter omitted, default batching criteria defined app used. batch_by Batching criteria form list. example:   use_interruptible_instances field can TRUE FALSE. Set field TRUE allow use spot instances. action set run, task run immediately upon creation. ... arguments can passed core api() function like 'fields', etc.
code: execution_settings <- list(   "instance_type" = "c4.2xlarge;ebs-gp2;2000",   "max_parallel_instances" = 2,   "use_memoization" = TRUE,   "use_elastic_disk" = TRUE   ) inputs <- list(   "input_file"= "<file_id/file_object>",   "input_directory" = "<folder_id/folder_object>",   "input_array_string" = list("<string_elem_1>", "<string_elem_2>"),   "input_boolean" = TRUE,   "input_double" = 54.6,   "input_enum" = "enum_1",   "input_float" = 11.2,   "input_integer" = "asdf",   "input_long" = 4212,   "input_string" = "test_string",   "input_record" = list(     "input_record_field_file" = "<file_id/file_object>",     "input_record_field_integer" = 42    )   ) batch_by = list(   type = "CRITERIA",   criteria = list("metadata.condition") )

title: R6 Class representing tasks endpoints — Tasks
text: project ID project Project object want create task . app ID app App object want run. Recall apps specified projects, form {project_id}/{app_name}. revision app revision (version) number. name name task. description optional description task. execution_settings Named list detailed task execution parameters. Detailed task execution parameters: instance_type: Possible value specific instance type, e.g. "instance_type" = "c4.2xlarge;ebs-gp2;2000"; max_parallel_instances: Maximum number instances running time. Takes integer value equal greater 1, e.g. "max_parallel_instances" = 2.; use_memoization: Set FALSE default. Set TRUE enable memoization; use_elastic_disk: Set TRUE enable Elastic Disk. example:   inputs List objects. See section specifying task inputs information creating task input objects. example various input types:   output_location output location list allows define exact location task outputs stored. location can either defined entire project using main_location parameter, individually per output node, setting nodes_override parameter true defining individual output node locations within nodes_location. See details. main_location - Defines output location output nodes task. Can string path within project task created, example /Analysis/<task_id>_<task_name>/ path attached volume, volumes://volume_name/<project_id>/html. Parts path enclosed angle brackets <> tokens dynamically replaced corresponding values task execution. main_location_alias: string location (path) project point actual location outputs stored. Used main_location defined volume path (starting volumes://), provide easy way accessing output data directly project files. nodes_override: Enables defining output locations output nodes individually nodes_location (see ). Set TRUE able define individual locations per output node. Default: FALSE. Even nodes_override set TRUE, necessary define output locations output nodes individually. Data output nodes locations explicitly defined nodes_location either placed main_location (defined) project files root main output location defined task. nodes_location: List output paths individual task output nodes following format output node:  = list( "output_location" = "", "output_location_alias" = "" ) {r} b64html = list( "output_location" = "volumes://outputs/tasks/mar-19", "output_location_alias" = "/rfranklin/tasks/picard" )  example , b64html ID output node want define output location, parameters defined follows: output_location - Can path within project task created, example /Analysis/<task_id>_<task_name>/ path attached volume, volumes://volume_name/<project_id>/html. Also accepts tokens. output_location_alias - location (path) project point exact location output stored. Used output_location defined volume path (starting volumes://). batch set FALSE default. Set TRUE create batch task specify batch_input batch-criteria described . batch_input ID input wish batch. typically batch input consisting list files. parameter omitted, default batching criteria defined app used. batch_by Batching criteria form list. example:   use_interruptible_instances field can TRUE FALSE. Set field TRUE allow use spot instances. action set run, task run immediately upon creation. ... arguments can passed core api() function like 'fields', etc.
code: execution_settings <- list(   "instance_type" = "c4.2xlarge;ebs-gp2;2000",   "max_parallel_instances" = 2,   "use_memoization" = TRUE,   "use_elastic_disk" = TRUE   ) inputs <- list(   "input_file"= "<file_id/file_object>",   "input_directory" = "<folder_id/folder_object>",   "input_array_string" = list("<string_elem_1>", "<string_elem_2>"),   "input_boolean" = TRUE,   "input_double" = 54.6,   "input_enum" = "enum_1",   "input_float" = 11.2,   "input_integer" = "asdf",   "input_long" = 4212,   "input_string" = "test_string",   "input_record" = list(     "input_record_field_file" = "<file_id/file_object>",     "input_record_field_integer" = 42    )   ) batch_by = list(   type = "CRITERIA",   criteria = list("metadata.condition") )

title: Core HTTP logic for Seven Bridges API — api
text: token API authentication token access_token Seven Bridges single sign-. Authentication token uniquely identifies ⁨Seven Bridges⁩ Platform data access, app management task execution permissions. Read usage . path Path connected base_url. method One "GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE", "PATCH". query Query parameters passed httr package GET/POST call. body Body content passed httr package GET/POST/PUT/DELETE/PATCH call. encode body named list, encoded? Can one "json" (application/json), "form" (application/x-www-form-urlencoded), "multipart" (multipart/form-data). Default "json". "multipart", list elements can strings objects created httr::upload_file(). "form", elements coerced strings escaped, use () prevent double-escaping. "json", parameters automatically "unboxed" (.e. length 1 vectors converted scalars). preserve length 1 vector vector, wrap (). limit maximum number collection items return single request. Minimum value 1. maximum value 100 default value 50. pagination-specific attribute. offset zero-based starting index entire collection first item return. default value 0. pagination-specific attribute. advance_access Enable advance access features? Default FALSE. authorization token API authentication token (FALSE) access token Seven Bridges single sign-(TRUE)? fields Selector specifying subset fields include response. API calls take optional query parameter. parameter enables specify fields want returned listing resources (e.g. projects) getting details specific resource (e.g. given project).  example, fields="id,name,size" return fields id, name size files. Default value set _all, fields always returned resource. details please check . base_url Platform URL, default NULL. url Full url resource. url provided, parameters like base_url, path, query, limit, offset fields ignored. ... arguments passed GET/POST/PUT/DELETE/PATCH call.
